title: Manchester United injury news: Diogo Dalot confirms spell on the sidelines
text:
Diogo Dalot has confirmed he’s set for a spell on the sidelines (Picture: Getty)

Manchester United full-back Diogo Dalot has vowed to return to injury ‘as soon as possible’ after picking up another knock against Newcastle before the international break.

The Portuguese defender has struggled to stay fit since joining the club from Porto in a deal worth around £18million in 2018.

The right-back has made just one start so far this term but was removed at St James’ Park after sustaining a leg injury.

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer signed Aaron Wan-Bissaka because of Dalot’s injury record but he rates the Portugese defender and wanted him to be first choice in the Europa League.

But Dalot confirmed today that he’s set for a stint on the sidelines, though he’s vowing to return quickly.

‘During the Newcastle game, as you all know I picked up an Injury,’ said Dalot.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I am now recovering, and already looking forward to joining back up with the team as soon as possible to help the boys get back to where we belong!’

United have picked up four points from their two Europa League matches and a win in Serbia would make them clear favourites to progress to the next round.

Solskjaer is expected to make a number of changes and is likely to bring in the likes of Angel Gomes, Brandon Williams and Phil Jones into the side.
